conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E, thank you for your candid note and for your continued strong interest in Nursery_C.

At this point, our remaining place is not being “held” for any single named family in the sense of a guaranteed reservation, but we do need to make any offer in line with our priority order if higher-priority families come forward and apply. As of now, we therefore can’t commit to offering you the place immediately.

That said, if the higher-priority options do not materialize, we would be able to reconsider. I understand this is uncertain, so please do continue to pursue your other options in parallel. If you would like to be considered again, you are welcome to submit an [APPLY] message at any time, and we will respond based on the then-current situation and our priorities.

Thank you again for your patience and understanding.

The best move is to respond transparently but non-committally: we cannot hold for specific named families, but we must follow our priority order; encourage Parent_E to keep other options active and, if they wish, to submit an [APPLY] later—while signaling we cannot promise an offer unless higher-priority options do not materialize.
